Hi!

> From the comments there and in File.renameTo, it seems notable reaso=
ns 
> it might fail are (1) can't rename between filesystems; and (2) 
> de=
stination file exists.

> 
> What filesystem(s) are you using? If you can s=
tep through the relevant 
> code, can you see if Restlet's 'tmp' file is in=
 a surprising (perhaps 
> different-filesystem) place?
> 
> We do expect th=
is PUT operation to usually replace an existing file, in 
> which case the =
JVM process will need all necessary permissions to do 
> that. If in fact t=
he fallback code works, it seems it must -- but 
> perhaps there is a permi=
ssions difference whereby the rename can't work 
> but a write-over can?
Th=
is is very strange! I have again debugged through the code and as far as I =
can see, there should not be any reason for the rename to fail. The tempora=
ry file is stored as '/tmp/restlet-xxxx' and should be renamed to '$HERITRI=
X_DIR/jobs/test/crawler-beans.cxml'. Both files are on the same ext3 partit=
ion and both files have the correct permissions.  The original destination =
file is deleted but still the rename fails...

I am somehow out of ideas. I=
 guess I have to run Heritrix with a patched Restlet version for the time b=
eing...

Best
Daniel
